definition: zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither

sentences.english: Romance is seeing flowers withering away you want to cry.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫是瞧见花将凋零想哭泣。

sentences.english: Your long summer will never fade.
A flower withered, not the whole barren spring.
sentences.chinese: 一花凋零，荒芜不了整个春天。

sentences.english: I am a tree with many branches, with fewer and fewer leaves on those branchlets each time you pass.
sentences.chinese: 一棵枝繁的树，在你悄然的身后，叶子片片凋零。

sentences.english: We can't let the art of Cantonese opera wither away.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能任由粤剧艺术日渐凋零。

sentences.english: Old Soldiers never die; they only fade away.
As young adults die, agriculture and industry falter.
sentences.chinese: 因为年轻人大量凋零，农业与工业也摇摇欲坠。

sentences.english: Life is like flowers blossom. Someday, it will be withered.
sentences.chinese: 花开花落昔年同，生命花，总有一天会凋零。

sentences.english: Not yet learned the bloom, had been accustomed to dying.
sentences.chinese: 尚未学会绽放，就已习于凋零。

sentences.english: Today he will die, as roses die.
sentences.chinese: 今天他将死去，宛若那玫瑰凋零。

sentences.english: Perhaps the moment I shut our eyes, gradually declining pyrotechnics.
sentences.chinese: 也许那一刻我闭上眼，烟火渐次凋零。

sentences.english: I am a flowering , not flower bloom has yet to learn.
sentences.chinese: 我是一朵不开花的花，尚未学会绽放，就已习于凋零。

sentences.english: And, as eternal youth is mine, you also shall be always green, and your leaf know no decay.
sentences.chinese: 我的青春常在，妳也将四季常青，绿叶永不凋零。

sentences.english: Seoul Tower at night and in the day… looks different.
sentences.chinese: 而白天的南山塔，秋风瑟瑟，一种凋零而凄美的景象。
有了您它就永不凋零残败。
而百花凋零的时候是秋天。

definition: to wither (and drop off)/to wilt/to pass away
to fall and wither (like autumn leaves)/(fig.) drifting and homeless
(of status or wealth) to decline/(of buildings etc) to become dilapidated/run-down/(of plants) to wilt
